sentence.text: Here, we identified three families with mutations in barbed-end actin filament capping, encoding for adducin-Î³, with intellectual disability, microcephaly, cataracts and skeletal defects.

In one of the families with additional cardiomyopathy and steroid-resistant nephrotic syndrome (SRNS), we found a homozygous variant in chromatin remodeling, encoding the lysine acetyltransferase 2B, with negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II on KAT2B protein levels in patient fibroblasts, suggesting that this second mutation might contribute to the increased disease spectrum.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
